pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with the President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with the President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, to discuss COVID-19.

Prime Minister Trudeau and President von der Leyen spoke about the strong measures in place in Canada and in European Union countries to protect health and safety and promote economic wellbeing.

The Prime Minister and the President discussed how best to coordinate the international response to COVID-19 in order to mitigate as much as possible the health, social, and economic impacts of the outbreak.

The two leaders exchanged views on the important role the G7 and G20 can play, in particular to support global economic activity. Prime Minister Trudeau and President von der Leyen agreed on the importance of further discussion of these efforts on the upcoming G7 leaders call.

COVID-19 is a rapidly evolving global challenge. The Government of Canada is working closely with local, provincial, territorial, and international partners to minimize its impacts in Canada and around the world.
